alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 10:52AM CDT until May 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River at Wayside 13NE affecting Armstrong County. ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Texas...Oklahoma... Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W affecting Hansford County. Cimarron River at Kenton 2NE affecting Cimarron County. For the Prairie Dog Town Fork...including Wayside 13NE...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River at Kenton 2NE. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Water is up to the lowest natural banks but within secondary banks. Low water crossings upstream and downstream are likely flooded. Fences below the secondary bank could sustain damage. No other known threats. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
